title: which, pursuant to subsection (4) of section 17 of that Act, a draft has been laid
heading: Recommendation of the Court made under Section 16 of the Industrial
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Recommendation of the Court made under Section 16 of the Industrial 
Relations (Amendment) Act, 2015 to amend its previous Recommendation 
confirmed by the Minister in S.I. No. 234 of 2019 and further amended by 
S.I. 598 of 2021 and S.I. 207 of 2023 (Referred to collectively as the order). 
The amendment should be by way of insertion of the following provisions 
into that order under the heading of Pay Pates, Pension Scheme and Sick 
Pay 

(1) That the order be amended so as to delete the text in the section headed 

pay rates contained therein and to replace the text with the following; 

The following minimum hourly rates of basic pay will apply in the sector from 

1st August 2025 to 31st July 2026 
Craftsperson 
Category A Worker 
Category B Worker 

€23.00 per hour 
€22.32 per hour 
€20.71 per hour 

Apprentice 

Year 1 - 33.33% of Craft Rate 
Year 2 - 50% of Craft Rate 
Year 3 - 75% of Craft Rate 
Year 4 - 90% of Craft Rate 

A minimum hourly rate of basic pay of €16.74 will apply for two years after 
entrance to the Sector to all New Entrant Operative Workers who are over the 
age of 18 years and entering the sector for the first time. 

The following minimum hourly rates of basic pay will apply in the sector from 

1st August 2026 
Craftsperson €23.74 per hour 
Category A Worker €23.03 per hour 
Category B Worker €21.37 per hour 

Apprentice 

Year 1 - 33.33% of Craft Rate 
Year 2 - 50% of Craft Rate 
Year 3 - 75% of Craft Rate 
Year 4 - 90% of Craft Rate 

A minimum hourly rate of basic pay of €17.28 will apply for two years after 
entrance to the Sector to all New Entrant Operative Workers who are over the 
age of 18 years and entering the sector for the first time. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [620] 

(2) That the order be amended so as to delete the text in the section headed 
Minimum Pension Contribution contained therein and to replace the text with 
the following; 

Minimum Pension Contribution 

Pension Contribution from 1st August 2025 to 31st July 2026 

Employer daily rate - €6.37 (weekly €31.87) 
Employee daily rate - €4.25 (weekly €21.27) 
Total contribution daily into the scheme per worker - €10.63 (weekly €53.14) 

Pension Contribution from 1st August 2026 
Employer daily rate - €6.58 (weekly €32.89) 
Employee daily rate - €4.39 (weekly €21.95) 
Total contribution daily into the scheme per worker - €10.97 (weekly €54.84) 

(3) That the order be amended so as to delete the text in the section headed 

Sick pay contained therein and to replace the text with the following; 

Sick Pay 

Weekly contribution with effect from the date of the coming into operation of 
the order: 

Employer €2.37 
Employee €0.63 
Total weekly contribution - €3.00 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 7 November 2024 

EMER HIGGINS, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and 

Employment
